name: A Biochar Project at Satyapura
description:
The Biochar Project at Satyapura, in Rajasthan, India transforms invasive Prosopis juliflora into durable biochar, beginning at 10 TPD and scaling to 50 TPD. In the second phase, the project will consider using agri-residue feedstocks such as mustard husk, castor and cotton-stalks which will be validated against Isometric's Biomass Protocol.

By diverting biomass from decay and combustion, the project locks carbon away for the long term while improving soils, reducing emissions, and supporting rural livelihoods. Every step of the process is digitally monitored and independently verified, ensuring full transparency.

The project takes its name from the historic region of Sanchore in western Rajasthan - once known as Satyapura, or the “city of truth.” In this spirit, it draws on ancestral wisdom and nature-based practices that honor the soil, the community, and the climate. By converting waste biomass into biochar, Satyapura restores degraded land, enriches soil organic carbon, and uplifts rural communities. At its heart, the project is about returning to the land’s truth - quietly and powerfully regenerating from what it has always known.
short_description: The Biochar Project at Satyapura, in Rajasthan, India transforms invasive Prosopis juliflora into durable biochar, beginning at 10 TPD and scaling to 50 TPD. By diverting biomass from decay and combustion, the project locks carbon away for the long term while improving soils, reducing emissions, and supporting rural livelihoods. Every step of the process is digitally monitored and independently verified, ensuring full transparency.

name: B10 - Brondal #1
description: B10 partners with local sawmills in White River, SA to produce biochar from wood chips created from the plantation grown timber waste streams. Using a purpose-built pyrolysis facility, the process ensures emissions control, efficiency, quality, and operational safety. The biochar is used in anaerobic digesters or inoculated and both streams end up as fertilizer/soil enhancer in agriculture.
short_description: B10 partners with local sawmills in White River, SA to produce biochar from wood chips created from the plantation grown timber waste streams. Using a purpose-built pyrolysis facility, the process ensures emissions control, efficiency, quality, and operational safety. The biochar is used in anaerobic digesters or inoculated and both streams end up as fertilizer/soil enhancer in agriculture.

name: Burnsville
description: Carba is pyrolyzing woody biomass into stable biochar and applying it as a soil amendment to daily cover over landfill waste for permanent carbon removal and co-benefits. The project is conducted in collaboration with the Burnsville Sanitary Landfill (BSL), a landfill operator, in Burnsville, MN. This project will receive feedstock from SETMN, an organic waste facility, and Asplundh who will supply tree trimmings from utility corridor management.
short_description: Carba is pyrolyzing woody biomass into stable biochar and applying it as a soil amendment to daily cover over landfill waste for permanent carbon removal and co-benefits. The project is conducted in collaboration with the Burnsville Sanitary Landfill (BSL), a landfill operator, in Burnsville, MN. This project will receive feedstock from SETMN, an organic waste facility, and Asplundh who will supply tree trimmings from utility corridor management.

name: Capital Link's Berthoud Facility
description: The Berthoud Biochar Facility, located in Berthoud, Colorado, removes carbon by converting waste wood into high-quality biochar through pyrolysis. Operating 24/7, the facility processes dozens of truckloads of wood each day using a highly integrated system for shredding, screening, and kiln loading. Once pyrolyzed, the biochar is cooled, cleaned, ground, and bagged for distribution. This process permanently stores carbon in a stable form, supporting long-term climate benefits while repurposing wood waste.
short_description: The Berthoud Biochar Facility in Colorado runs 24/7, converting waste wood into high-quality biochar through pyrolysis. Using an integrated system for shredding, screening, and kiln loading, it processes dozens of truckloads daily. The resulting biochar is cooled, cleaned, ground, and bagged - permanently storing carbon and repurposing wood waste.

name: Carboneers & Terrafront High Tech Biochar
description: Carboneers and Terrafront partner with smallholder farmers in Assam, India, to produce biochar from paddy straw waste streams with a small amount coming from corn stover. Using a centralized, high-tech pyrolysis facility tweaked to maximize biochar yield and quality, the process ensures emissions control, efficiency, quality, and operator safety. Once produced, the biochar is mixed with compost or manure and applied to nearby fields.
short_description: Carboneers and Together for Restoration partner with smallholder farmers in Assam, India, to produce biochar and apply it to nearby fields.

name: Charm Bio-oil Geologic Storage
description: Charm produces bio-oil, a carbon rich liquid made from unmerchantable wildfire prevention residues in Colorado and procures bio-oil produced by third parties, made from forest products processing residuals. A combination of rail and truck is used to transport bio-oil to injection well sites that are converted oil assets. Permanent sequestration will occur in multiple locations, such as Louisiana.
short_description: Charm produces bio-oil, a carbon rich liquid made from unmerchantable wildfire prevention residues in Colorado and procures bio-oil produced by third parties, made from forest products processing residuals. A combination of rail and truck is used to transport bio-oil to injection well sites that are converted oil assets. Permanent sequestration will occur in multiple locations, such as Louisiana.

name: Cocoa Biochar Carboneers
description: In Ghana, cocoa residues remain unutilized, leading to substantial GHG emissions and facilitating spread of pests and diseases. This project converts cocoa pods and prunings into biochar, thereby preventing significant methane emissions and reducing plant disease incidence associated with uncontrolled decomposition of these residues. Given the absence of infrastructure for centralized feedstock collection, Carboneers Coco Kilns are deployed at the village level. Each kiln is equipped with continuous monitoring systems to ensure optimal pyrolysis conditions.
short_description: In Ghana, cocoa residues remain unutilized, leading to substantial GHG emissions and facilitating spread of pests and diseases. This project converts cocoa pods and prunings into biochar, thereby preventing significant methane emissions and reducing plant disease incidence associated with uncontrolled decomposition of these residues. Given the absence of infrastructure for centralized feedstock collection, Carboneers Coco Kilns are deployed at the village level. Each kiln is equipped with continuous monitoring systems to ensure optimal pyrolysis conditions.

name: Corigin-1: BioChar Q3-25
description:
Corigin is a carbon removal business that produces multiple high value products from agricultural wastes. Biochar soil amendments help farmers increase yields and soil fertility while reducing chemical, fertilizer and water use. 

We help the World. Our biochar permanently removes Carbon from atmosphere and sequesters it into the earth where it remains in the soil for thousands of years.
short_description:
Corigin is a carbon removal business that produces multiple high value products from agricultural wastes. Biochar soil amendments help farmers increase yields and soil fertility while reducing chemical, fertilizer and water use. 

We help the World. Our biochar permanently removes Carbon from atmosphere and sequesters it into the earth where it remains in the soil for thousands of years.

name: Darjeeling Revival: Alt x MOL
description: The project is anchored in regions where high rainfall, humidity, and warm summers accelerate silicate mineral dissolution and other key geochemical processes. It sequesters atmospheric CO₂, while enhancing soil health, improving productivity, strengthening the local economy, preserving biodiversity, and advancing sustainable land management practices.
short_description: The project is anchored in regions where high rainfall, humidity, and warm summers accelerate silicate mineral dissolution and other key geochemical processes. It sequesters atmospheric CO₂, while enhancing soil health, improving productivity, strengthening the local economy, preserving biodiversity, and advancing sustainable land management practices.

name: Darjeeling Revival: Monsoon Harvest
description: The project is primarily focused on the Terai region, leveraging the high rainfall, warm summers, and collaboration with local tea growers. The project enhances soil health and crop productivity while sequestering atmospheric CO₂. This approach aids in carbon removal and supports the local economy, preserves biodiversity, and promotes sustainable agricultural practices.
short_description: The project is primarily focused on the Terai region, leveraging the high rainfall, warm summers, and collaboration with local tea growers. The project enhances soil health and crop productivity while sequestering atmospheric CO₂. This approach aids in carbon removal and supports the local economy, preserves biodiversity, and promotes sustainable agricultural practices.

name: Darjeeling Revival Project
description: The project is primarily focused on the Terai region, leveraging the high rainfall, warm summers, and collaboration with local tea growers. The project enhances soil health and crop productivity while sequestering atmospheric CO₂. This approach aids in carbon removal and supports the local economy, preserves biodiversity, and promotes sustainable agricultural practices.
short_description: The project is primarily focused on the Terai region, leveraging the high rainfall, warm summers, and collaboration with local tea growers. The project enhances soil health and crop productivity while sequestering atmospheric CO₂. This approach aids in carbon removal and supports the local economy, preserves biodiversity, and promotes sustainable agricultural practices.

name: Deep Sky Alpha
description: Deep Sky Alpha is a facility that evaluates the energy consumption, operability, and reliability of various direct air capture technologies under real-world conditions. The project encompasses the capture, liquefaction, transport, and sequestration of CO₂. CO₂ captured at Alpha is transported by road and sequestered off-site.
short_description: Deep Sky Alpha is a facility that evaluates the energy consumption, operability, and reliability of various direct air capture technologies under real-world conditions. The project encompasses the capture, liquefaction, transport, and sequestration of CO₂. CO₂ captured at Alpha is transported by road and sequestered off-site.

name: Great Plains Organic Waste Sequestration
description: Vaulted deploys slurry injection technology to geologically sequester organic wastes for the purpose of permanent carbon removal. Vaulted owns and operates a built and permitted injection well site in Hutchinson, Kansas. This site hosts a network of 60 salt caverns, with the total capacity to hold 2-3 million metric tons of organic waste and room to expand beyond that. Vaulted secures a range of organic wastes (including biosolids, livestock and agricultural waste, paper sludge, and others) through sustainable sourcing practices from the surrounding area. Vaulted then minimally processes the waste on-site and geologically injects them, permanently (10,000+ years) sequestering the carbon.
short_description: Vaulted owns and operates a built and permitted slurry injection well site in Hutchinson, Kansas. Vaulted secures a range of end-of-life organic wastes, which are minimally processed on site, and geologically injected for permanent underground storage.

name: Hampton Roads WAE Project
description: CREW removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by deploying fine-grained natural minerals like calcium carbonate in wastewater treatment systems. The deployment location for this project includes wastewater facilities operated by the Hampton Roads Sanitation District (“HRSD”), a political subdivision of the Commonwealth of Virginia, serving the Hampton Roads region.
short_description: CREW removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by deploying fine-grained natural minerals like calcium carbonate in wastewater treatment systems. The deployment location for this project includes wastewater facilities operated by the Hampton Roads Sanitation District (“HRSD”), a political subdivision of the Commonwealth of Virginia, serving the Hampton Roads region.

name: Humboldt Sawmill Company (HSC)
description:
Pacific Biochar specializes in the production and distribution of high-quality biochar products designed to sequester carbon while enhancing agricultural and industrial productivity. Pacific Biochar utilizes existing biomass power plant infrastructure to produce biochar, enabling rapid scaling potential with low capital investments. The partnerships we make with these bioenergy facilities result in cascading community benefits including wildfire risk reduction, rural job growth, and improved food security.
Biochar production, located in Scotia, CA with annual credit production of ~10,600 tCO2e/year
short_description: Pacific Biochar specializes in the production and distribution of high-quality biochar products designed to sequester carbon while enhancing agricultural and industrial productivity. Pacific Biochar utilizes existing biomass power plant infrastructure to produce biochar, enabling rapid scaling potential with low capital investments. The partnerships we make with these bioenergy facilities result in cascading community benefits including wildfire risk reduction, rural job growth, and improved food security. Biochar production, located in Scotia, CA with annual credit production of ~10,600 tCO2e/year

name: INTERCARBO
description: INTERCARBO, Interholco’s biochar production facility in northern Republic of Congo, transforms sawmill waste into biochar through an advanced pyrolysis process. This sustainable initiative prevents open-air burning, reducing emissions and improving air quality. The produced biochar serves as a long-term carbon sink in Interholco’s own forest concession, and is buried under abandoned forest roads. By turning wood waste into a valuable resource, InterCarbo contributes to climate change mitigation and ecological restoration.
short_description: INTERCARBO, Interholco’s biochar production facility in northern Republic of Congo, transforms sawmill waste into biochar through an advanced pyrolysis process. This sustainable initiative prevents open-air burning, reducing emissions and improving air quality. The produced biochar serves as a long-term carbon sink in Interholco’s own forest concession, and is buried under abandoned forest roads. By turning wood waste into a valuable resource, InterCarbo contributes to climate change mitigation and ecological restoration.

name: KARBOTECH one
description: MicroCHAR® is a unique project providing customers with technology that uses agricultural residues to produce the MicroCHAR® soil conditioner. This soil conditioner is used to regenerate the soil while simultaneously extracting carbon from CO2 and storing it within the soil permanently. Biochar represents the permanent removal of carbon from CO2, thus generating tradable carbon certificates.

name: Kvina River CDR Project
description: Kvina River CDR Project results in the drawdown and permanent storage of CO2 that would otherwise reside in the atmosphere. By adding finely crushed natural alkaline rock, the river’s pH, calcium, and total alkalinity are increased, strengthening ecosystem health and resilience in both the river and estuary. The alkaline material reacts with dissolved CO₂ to form stable bicarbonate ions, which increase the river’s dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) load. As these bicarbonates flow to the ocean, they provide permanent, safe carbon storage for millennia while also improving water chemistry.
short_description: Kvina River CDR Project results in the drawdown and permanent storage of CO2 that would otherwise reside in the atmosphere. By adding finely crushed natural alkaline rock, the river’s pH, calcium, and total alkalinity are increased, strengthening ecosystem health and resilience in both the river and estuary. The alkaline material reacts with dissolved CO₂ to form stable bicarbonate ions, which increase the river’s dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) load. As these bicarbonates flow to the ocean, they provide permanent, safe carbon storage for millennia while also improving water chemistry.

name: La Perla
description: The La Perla project involves spreading highly-reactive volcanic feedstock across 201 hectares of sugarcane fields, in partnership with smallholder farmers, to permanently remove over 1,500 tons of CO2 and improve crop yields.
short_description: The La Perla project involves spreading highly-reactive volcanic feedstock across 201 hectares of sugarcane fields, in partnership with smallholder farmers, to permanently remove over 1,500 tons of CO2 and improve crop yields.

name: Loblolly Project
description:
Graphyte’s Carbon Casting technology transforms biomass residues from the agriculture and timber industries into durable carbon removal. The Carbon Casting process involves drying and compressing biomass residues into stable ‘carbon blocks.’ These blocks are wrapped in a waterproof barrier designed to prevent carbon from re-entering the atmosphere for over 1,000 years. The blocks are then stored underground in an engineered chamber with a gas detection system that directly monitors for carbon dioxide and methane. 

The Loblolly Project in Pine Bluff, Arkansas is the first deployment of Graphyte’s Carbon Casting technology. The Project utilizes excess sawdust, bark, and rice hulls produced from local farmers and timber companies in Southeast Arkansas.
short_description: The Loblolly Project is Graphyte's first deployment in Pine Bluff, Arkansas. This project turns local rice hulls and sawmill residues into durable carbon removal through the Carbon Casting process.

name: Moser River
description: CarbonRun will implement River Alkalinity Enhancement (RAE) on the Moser River, Nova Scotia, starting Fall 2025. This involves adding finely crushed natural alkaline rock to the river, which reacts with CO₂ to form stable bicarbonate, increasing the river's dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) transport capacity. Once transported to the ocean, this bicarbonate is stored for over 1,000 years. The project aims to permanently sequester carbon and improve water quality to support healthier ecosystems.
short_description: CarbonRun will implement River Alkalinity Enhancement (RAE) on the Moser River, Nova Scotia, starting Fall 2025. This involves adding finely crushed natural alkaline rock to the river, which reacts with CO₂ to form stable bicarbonate, increasing the river's dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) transport capacity. Once transported to the ocean, this bicarbonate is stored for over 1,000 years. The project aims to permanently sequester carbon and improve water quality to support healthier ecosystems.

name: MVC Biochar
description: This Biochar Carbon Removal project, the first of its kind in Chile, uses locally built, stationary double-barrel retort kilns for slow pyrolysis of residual Eucalyptus biomass. Operating at 400–600°C, each kiln produces high-carbon biochar with a low H/C ratio for use exclusively in soils. The first unit launches in 2025, with five more planned for 2026, targeting an annual output of ~3,110 tonnes of biochar and up to 8,806 carbon removal credits. Managed by Carbono Capital SpA, the project integrates regenerative agriculture, digital MRV tools, and community-based compost-biochar application, creating durable sustainable livelihoods on family-owned farmland.
short_description: This Biochar Carbon Removal project, the first of its kind in Chile, uses locally built, stationary double-barrel retort kilns for slow pyrolysis of residual Eucalyptus biomass. Operating at 400–600°C, each kiln produces high-carbon biochar with a low H/C ratio for use exclusively in soils. The first unit launches in 2025, with five more planned for 2026, targeting an annual output of ~3,110 tonnes of biochar and up to 8,806 carbon removal credits. Managed by Carbono Capital SpA, the project integrates regenerative agriculture, digital MRV tools, and community-based compost-biochar application, creating durable sustainable livelihoods on family-owned farmland.

name: New England WAE Project
description: CREW removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere via wastewater treatment systems, deploying fine-grained natural minerals like calcium carbonate in wastewater treatment systems. The deployment locations for this project are municipal wastewater facilitiies that serve the New England area and discharge directly into the ocean. Onsite, the feedstock is transferred into CREW’s dosing systems, and is dosed into the wastewater treatment reactors as a slurry. CREW’s system controls the rate of dosing to optimize process benefits and CDR.
short_description: CREW removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere via wastewater treatment systems, deploying fine-grained natural minerals like calcium carbonate in wastewater treatment systems

name: Nova Scotia Mineral OAE Project
description: Planetary Technologies add alkaline compounds to seawater to enhance the natural ability of seawater to absorb atmospheric carbon dioxide, storing the carbon in dissolved carbon-containing ions in the oceans for 10,000-100,000 years.
short_description: Planetary Technologies add alkaline compounds to seawater to enhance the natural ability of seawater to absorb atmospheric carbon dioxide, storing the carbon in dissolved carbon-containing ions in the oceans for 10,000-100,000 years.

name: Ontario Avenue Bio-Oil Sequestration
description: NULIFE GreenTech utilizes patented Hydrothermal Liquefaction (HTL) technology to convert waste biomass into carbon dense bio-oil. The Ontario Avenue project is in Saskatoon, SK, Canada. The Project utilizes wet and dry waste biomass from local food processing facilities. The bio-oil is transported to a third-party injection site for sequestration into a Canadian underground salt cavern. This project is the first commercial deployment of NULIFE’s modular and rapidly deployable HTL technology. The Ontario Avenue site will act as a showcase facility to validate unmatched biomass feedstock flexibility and versatile output capabilities for a range of high-value co-products.
short_description: NULIFE GreenTech utilizes patented Hydrothermal Liquefaction (HTL) technology to convert waste biomass into carbon dense bio-oil. The Ontario Avenue project is in Saskatoon, SK, Canada. The Project utilizes wet and dry waste biomass from local food processing facilities. The bio-oil is transported to a third-party injection site for sequestration into a Canadian underground salt cavern. This project is the first commercial deployment of NULIFE’s modular and rapidly deployable HTL technology. The Ontario Avenue site will act as a showcase facility to validate unmatched biomass feedstock flexibility and versatile output capabilities for a range of high-value co-products.

name: Project Araçari
description: Enhanced Weathering project executed on agricultural land in Brazil. The purpose of the project is to remove carbon durably through the application of locally sourced basaltic rock powder whilst restoring degraded soils. The project activity involves spreading basalt rock powder (20t/ha) on a Citrus (orange) plantation of 358ha. The rock powder is supplied from a local feedstock supplier. The basalt is a certified remineralizer, which is legally certified for agronomic application with strict physio-chemical and mineralogical requirements.
short_description: Enhanced Weathering project executed on agricultural land in Brazil. The purpose of the project is to remove carbon durably through the application of locally sourced basaltic rock powder whilst restoring degraded soils.

name: Project Carcará
description: Terradot sources finely ground basaltic rock powder from local quarries and applies it to agricultural land in order to remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere for >1,000 years.
short_description: Terradot sources finely ground basaltic rock powder from local quarries and applies it to agricultural land in order to remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere for >1,000 years.

name: Project Elbe 1
description: Planeteers' first project captures CO₂ from a power plant that burns methane produced through the fermentation of sewage sludge. The captured CO₂ reacts with alkaline material, converting it into dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) in the form of bicarbonate and carbonate. The resulting solution is released into the ocean, where the carbon remains stored for more than 1,000 years.
short_description: Planeteers' first project captures CO₂ from a power plant that burns methane produced through the fermentation of sewage sludge. The captured CO₂ reacts with alkaline material, converting it into dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) in the form of bicarbonate and carbonate. The resulting solution is released into the ocean, where the carbon remains stored for more than 1,000 years.

name: Project Juniper
description: Project Juniper is a direct air capture (DAC) and ex-situ mineralization project owned by Clairity and operated by Clairity. Project Juniper captures atmospheric CO2 using Clairity’s novel, low-cost, and scalable approach to DAC, storing CO2 permanently in carbonated materials using a closed, engineered ex-situ mineralization process. Project Juniper is carbon negative and water positive, generating water for water-stressed communities in the Southern Nevada region where the project is located. Project Juniper is fully electric and can be powered by clean energy from the local grid operator.
short_description: Project Juniper captures atmospheric CO2 using Clairity’s novel, low-cost, and scalable approach to DAC, storing CO2 permanently in carbonated materials using a closed, engineered ex-situ mineralization process.

name: Project Nandani
description: Project Nandani converts sugarcane residues into high-quality biochar through advanced pyrolysis in Maharashtra’s sugarcane belt, preventing open-field burning and enabling durable carbon storage. The project improves soil fertility and water retention, supports regenerative agriculture, and generates verified carbon removal credits under the Isometric Standard—linking climate action with rural livelihoods.
short_description: Project Nandani converts sugarcane residues into high-quality biochar through advanced pyrolysis in Maharashtra’s sugarcane belt, preventing open-field burning and enabling durable carbon storage. The project improves soil fertility and water retention, supports regenerative agriculture, and generates verified carbon removal credits under the Isometric Standard—linking climate action with rural livelihoods.

name: Project Serra da Mantiqueira
description: Enhanced Weathering project executed on ~1000 Ha of sugarcane plantation in Brazil. The purpose of the project is to remove carbon durably through the application of locally sourced basaltic rock powder, at an application rate of 10t/Ha, whilst restoring degraded soils. The maximum removal potential of the rock powder spread equates to approximately 2700t CO₂e. The project name reflects a symbol of cultural and ecological diversity in Brazil and means "Raindrop".
short_description: Enhanced Weathering project executed on ~1000 Ha of sugarcane plantation in Brazil. The purpose of the project is to remove carbon durably through the application of locally sourced basaltic rock powder, at an application rate of 10t/Ha, whilst restoring degraded soils. The maximum removal potential of the rock powder spread equates to approximately 2700t CO₂e. The project name reflects a symbol of cultural and ecological diversity in Brazil and means "Raindrop".

name: Range & Plains Biochar
description: Charm co-produces bio-oil and biochar at our pyrolysis facility in Fort Lupton, CO from non-merchantable woody biomass sourced from government-funded wildfire mitigation/management projects. Charm procures pyrolysis bio-oil produced by AE Cote-Nord Canada Bioenergy Inc (AECN) from waste material produced by a nearby lumber mill. We transport biochar via truck to various sites where it is sequestered via land application. Charm is in the process of securing agreements for offtake and storage of biochar. The locations of storage sites are presently unknown. Charm will report storage site locations and boundaries upon successful execution of an offtake agreement.
short_description: Charm co-produces bio-oil and biochar at our pyrolysis facility in Fort Lupton, CO from non-merchantable woody biomass sourced from government-funded wildfire mitigation/management projects. Charm procures pyrolysis bio-oil produced by AE Cote-Nord Canada Bioenergy Inc (AECN) from waste material produced by a nearby lumber mill. We transport biochar via truck to various sites where it is sequestered via land application. Charm is in the process of securing agreements for offtake and storage of biochar. The locations of storage sites are presently unknown. Charm will report storage site locations and boundaries upon successful execution of an offtake agreement.

name: Seoni Enhanced Rock Weathering Project
description: This project covers Mati’s ERW deployments in Seoni, India, where Mati is applying basalt powder sourced from the Deccan Traps. During growing seasons, rice paddies experience extremely high water fluxes, which helps to expedite basalt dissolution and thus, CO2 drawdown. Mati works exclusively with smallholder farmers. Mati’s ERW deployments are agricultural interventions that act to improve productivity of cropland at smallholder farms. Mati’s ERW deployments provide outsized value to smallholder farmers who often cannot afford agricultural inputs such as fertilizer or pH balancing agents.
short_description: This project covers Mati’s ERW deployments in Seoni, India, where Mati is applying basalt powder sourced from the Deccan Traps.

name: TIRE Project
description: Vaulted deploys slurry injection technology to geologically sequester organic wastes for the purpose of permanent carbon removal. The TIRE facility is a biosolids injection well co-located with the City of LA's Terminal Island wastewater treatment plant. Over the course of its operations over ten years, the site has safely and effectively injected more than 450,000 tons of biosolids. Vaulted has not yet generated any carbon removal units (CRUs) from TIRE – activities are currently supported through tipping fees from the City of Los Angeles. Vaulted has waived fees for waste volumes over the 5-year baseline to enable the city to send additional volumes to the site. Vault only credits those volumes over the baseline.
short_description: Vaulted deploys slurry injection technology to geologically sequester organic wastes for the purpose of permanent carbon removal. The TIRE facility is a biosolids injection well co-located with the City of LA's Terminal Island wastewater treatment plant. Over the course of its operations over ten years, the site has safely and effectively injected more than 450,000 tons of biosolids. Vaulted has not yet generated any carbon removal units (CRUs) from TIRE – activities are currently supported through tipping fees from the City of Los Angeles. Vaulted has waived fees for waste volumes over the 5-year baseline to enable the city to send additional volumes to the site. Vault only credits those volumes over the baseline.

name: Treehouse Plant 1
description: Sitos Treehouse Plant 1, LLC transforms almond shell into highly durable biochar—made by growers, used by growers—to store carbon, enrich soils, and build a more regenerative future.
short_description: Sitos Treehouse Plant 1, LLC transforms almond shell into highly durable biochar—made by growers, used by growers—to store carbon, enrich soils, and build a more regenerative future.

name: U.S. Agroforestry & Reforestation using Long-term Leases
description: The project aims to implement agroforestry practices such as alley cropping—combined with cover crops, reduced tillage, and improved residue management—by planting trees in rows on farmlands producing corn, soybeans, hay, and other monoculture grains.
short_description: The project aims to implement agroforestry practices such as alley cropping—combined with cover crops, reduced tillage, and improved residue management—by planting trees in rows on farmlands producing corn, soybeans, hay, and other monoculture grains.

name: US Southeast Enhanced Weathering Project
description: This project outlines Lithos Carbon's ERW efforts in the subtropical Southeast U.S., applying superfine byproduct basalt dust to farmland for durable carbon removal. Through rigorous field sampling and a robust analytical monitoring pipeline, Lithos ensures high-integrity CDR quantifications. By sourcing byproduct superfine rockdust directly from nearby quarries and working directly with both smallholders and large farms, Lithos minimizes life-cycle emissions while improving soil health, enhancing cropland productivity, and delivering direct financial benefits to farming communities- enabling the scalable deployment of ERW across hundreds of thousands of acres.
short_description: This project outlines Lithos Carbon's ERW efforts in the subtropical Southeast U.S., applying superfine byproduct basalt dust to farmland for durable carbon removal.

name: Varhad Industrial Cotton Stalk Biochar Project
description: The Varhad Indistrial Cotton Stalk (VICOS) project involves setting up industrial biochar pyrolysis reactors in the Vidarbha region of Maharashtra for the purpose of converting agri waste in the form of cotton stalk into biochar. This biochar is then mixed with organically produced compost at the same location to produce enriched blended biochar (called Biochaar++) for application in agricultural soils.
short_description: The Varhad Indistrial Cotton Stalk (VICOS) biochar project involves setting up industrial biochar pyrolysis reactors in the Vidarbha region of Maharashtra for the purpose of converting agricultural cotton stalk into biochar. This biochar is then mixed with organically produced compost at the same location and converted into enriched blended biochar (Biochaar++) for application in agricultural soils.

name: ZX-24 Vulkaneifel
description: ZeroEx implements Enhanced Rock Weathering (ERW) projects in Germany, utilizing a basaltic rock powder byproduct from existing mining operations, and a novel, highly scalable MRV method that improves measurement accuracy and reduces costs. Through extensive exploration screening over 100+ quarries in Germany, ZeroEx has secured a steady supply of feedstocks with above-average CDR potentials and low concentrations of potentially toxic elements, ensuring compliance with Germany’s strict environmental regulations. By focusing on local deployments with transport distances under a 30 km radius from quarries, ZeroEx minimizes its projects’ carbon footprint while supporting local, family-owned farms to adopt sustainable practices. In 2024, ZeroEx spread 22,854 metric tons of basalt across fields of 18 partner farmers. The projects offer both socio-economic benefits as well as several agronomic advantages, including reduced emissions from traditional agricultural liming practices.
short_description: ZeroEx implements Enhanced Rock Weathering (ERW) projects in Germany, utilizing a basaltic rock powder byproduct from existing mining operations, and a novel, highly scalable MRV method that improves measurement accuracy and reduces costs.
